author: Natalia Marques
title: Biden wraps up another dismal year : Peoples Dispatch
text: Biden is about to wrap another dismal year as his administration’s participation in the genocide in Israel is set to wreak havoc on his 2024 presidential campaign. People across the US have been taking to the streets, protesting the ongoing Israeli’s siege on Palestinians in Gaza since October 8. As the death toll in Gaza nears 22,000, the United States and the Biden administration continue to unconditionally support Israel. As a result, voters, especially Arab-American voters, have abandoned their support for Biden and the Democratic Party [in droves](https://www.npr.org/2023/11/17/1213668804/arab-americans-michigan-voters-biden-israel-hamas-palestinians). But Biden is no stranger to neglecting the demands of his base, as his record as president has shown: 1. Mass protests condemn Biden’s participation in genocide The Biden administration as directly and indirectly facilitated the genocide in Gaza. Biden himself has [bypassed Congress](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/12/12/the-world-goes-on-strike-for-palestine/) to send weapons to Israel, and continues to push for massive Israel military aid packages at the legislative level. The seven-day pause in Israeli aggression ended following Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s visit to the state, when he essentially gave the [greenlight](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/12/09/as-the-us-vetoes-unsc-ceasefire-resolution-the-people-take-the-streets-for-palestine/) to Israel to resume strikes on Gaza. Biden has participated in pro-genocide rhetoric, openly [questioning](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/12/09/as-the-us-vetoes-unsc-ceasefire-resolution-the-people-take-the-streets-for-palestine/) the validity of the Palestinian death toll. The White House went as far to condemn the progressive congress members calling for a ceasefire, calling the pressure for peace [“repugnant”](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/12/04/the-us-political-establishment-has-remained-complicit-in-israels-crimes-every-step-of-the-way/) and “disgraceful.” 2. Working class in jeopardy as social safety net destroyed Biden’s domestic policy is a reflection of overzealous military spending and a willingness to neglect the needs of his own people. Biden has allowed for the further destruction of the COVID-era social safety net during his presidency. Due to the so-called “unwinding” of pandemic-era public healthcare expansion, [at least 2.2 million children](https://www.axios.com/2023/12/19/children-health-insurance-medicaid-unwinding#:~:text=Context%3A%20At%20least%202.2%20million,for%20Medicare%20and%20Medicaid%20Services.) have been removed from the government insurance program Medicaid and the Children’s Health Insurance Program—although the real number could be [closer to 3 million](https://ccf.georgetown.edu/subtopic/unwinding-phe/). Experts say that Biden [has not done enough](https://apnews.com/article/medicaid-eligibility-texas-florida-disenrollments-fe7c10276e86ab909060dd6fbea60328) to stop the purging of up to 30 million people from public health insurance programs. It is not only states with Republican leadership that are some of the worst offenders in “purging” people off of Medicaid roles—states with governors [from Biden’s own Democratic Party](https://www.politico.com/news/2023/08/09/bidens-health-care-wins-undone-medicaid-00110389) are also doing the same. “The same Congress where the Democrats control the Senate, the Republicans barely control the house, five million people, and more than 1.5 million of them are children, who can no longer go to a doctor because Congress has decided that Medicaid expansion, which took place during COVID has been rescinded,” [said](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/09/07/brian-becker-it-is-time-for-us-movements-to-decide-stand-with-the-masses-or-stand-on-the-sidelines/) socialist leader Brian Becker at the Dilemmas of Humanity conference in Atlanta this summer. “It’s not because they don’t have the money, they decided to do this. They decided to do this. I mean they just spent [880 billion dollars](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/congress-passes-886-billion-defense-policy-bill-biden-sign-into-law-2023-12-14/) for the next military budget for one year. 880 billion dollars. And they’re saying we don’t have the money for low income families and their children to go to a doctor?” 3. Cost of living squeezes workers as Biden looks on Meanwhile, conditions remain dire for working people, with [over half of those surveyed](https://www.census.gov/data/tables/2023/demo/hhp/hhp63.html) by the US Census having some difficulty affording basic weekly expenses. Food prices have risen dramatically during Biden’s administration, rising by [10.6%](https://www.bls.gov/opub/ted/2022/consumer-price-index-up-7-1-percent-over-the-year-ended-november-2022.htm) from November 2021 to November 2022, and continuing to rise by [2.9%](https://www.nerdwallet.com/article/finance/price-of-food) from November 2022 to November 2021—in part due to the ongoing war in Ukraine that Biden only wants to continue. 4. Student loan borrowers granted no relief due to Biden’s failures Federal student loan payments, which had been on pause since March 2020, resumed on October 1 of this year following a series of failures by the Biden administration and Democrats to enact significant debt relief. In August of 2022, Biden [ launched a student loan debt relief program that](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/02/07/bidens-student-loan-forgiveness-program-in-jeopardy/) would have zeroed out the debts of 20 million people. However, conservatives led legal challenges against the program that immediately halted it before anyone’s debt could be forgiven. The case against the program was taken up all the way to the conservative Supreme Court, which [ struck down](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2023/06/30/us-supreme-court-strikes-down-student-debt-relief-another-blow-to-education-for-all/) the measure in June. The Debt Collective, a group which organizes student loan borrowers into a “debtor’s union,” claims that Biden had executive authority to [do far more](https://tools.debtcollective.org/run/student/#/1) to keep college grads out of debt. 5. Building on a legacy of broken promises Biden started off his presidency breaking major campaign promises to the people of the US. One major promise was to raise the federal minimum wage from a paltry USD 7.25 an hour to USD 15, a goal of the organized labor movement for many years. Instead, only a few months into his presidency, he gave up all pretenses of a fight by surrendering to a technicality in the Senate proceedings, which his administration [could have easily bypassed](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2021/03/01/deciphering-bidens-excuse-to-abandon-the-fight-for-15/). Also early into his presidency, Biden [shorted](https://peoplesdispatch.org/2021/03/11/bidens-stimulus-plan-falls-short-of-addressing-deep-economic-inequality-in-the-us/) the people of the United States on stimulus checks. In the version of Biden’s American Rescue Plan that was finally passed by Congress in March of 2021, the originally planned COVID-19 stimulus check was brought down from USD 2,000, as promised by Biden and the Democrats during his election campaign, to USD 1,400. The additional weekly unemployment benefits of USD 300 passed in the Plan were much smaller than the USD 600 that was previously afforded in the CARES Act, passed in March of 2020 during Trump’s presidency. Biden [put up zero fight](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/06/business/economy/unemployment-benefits.html#:~:text=Jobs%20Report-,Unemployment%20Benefits%20Expire%20for%20Millions%20Without%20Pushback%20From%20Biden,enhanced%20federal%20aid%20to%20end.) in September of 2021, when expanded pandemic-era unemployment benefits expired for 7.5 million people. It is highly likely that the candidates from the two major parties in 2024 will be Biden and Trump—two presidents who oversaw the deterioration of the living conditions of the vast majority of people in the US. Many are looking for an alternative to the Republican and Democratic tickets. Several strong contenders for President have emerged, including the socialist and anti-imperialist campaign of Claudia De La Cruz, which has been openly challenging Biden’s policy regarding Israel, among other things. This Christmas Eve, may the world remember that Genocide Joe and the settler colonial state of Israel have killed over 10,000 Palestinian children. They have killed baby Jesus 10,000 times over. They have taken the holy out of Christmas Day. May we continue to fight for a free… [https://t.co/mCEaIn7hMw] — Claudia (@Claud9_) [December 24, 2023]

author: @zazoomblog
title: La Maimeri a rischio chiusura con trasloco in Inghilterra Protestano i 43 lavoratori di Mediglia
text:
La Maimeri a rischio chiusura con trasloco in Inghilterra Protestano i 43 lavoratori di Mediglia
Mediglia (Milano), 27 marzo 2025 - Risposte chiare e una precisa strategia industriale per salvaguardare l’occupazione. È quanto chiedono i lavoratori e le lavoratrici della Maimeri, storica ditta di Mediglia specializzata nella produzione di tempere e vernici per le Belle Arti. Col supporto di Filctem Cgil e Femca Cisl, il personale e le Rsu hanno proclamato per la giornata di oggi uno sciopero, con un sit-in davanti ai cancelli dell’azienda, per protestare contro l’ipotesi di una delocalizzazione della produzione nel Regno Unito e la conseguente chiusura del sito di Mediglia, che attualmente impiega 43 persone tra operai e amministrativi. Lo spostamento delle attività oltre Manica è uno degli scenari ventilati dalla proprietà, la Fila (Fabbrica italiana lapis e affini), che dal 2014 detiene il 51% delle quote della Maimeri.Leggi su Ilgiorno.it
Ilgiorno.it - La Maimeri a rischio chiusura, con trasloco in Inghilterra. Protestano i 43 lavoratori di Mediglia
- La Maimeri a rischio chiusura, con trasloco in Inghilterra. Protestano i 43 lavoratori di Mediglia
- Mediglia, Maimeri a rischio chiusura: i lavoratori si preparano allo sciopero
- Fila-Maimeri: a rischio 43 posti di lavoro e un secolo di storia industriale
- Mediglia, è sciopero: "Per la Maimeri rischio chiusura"
- Mediglia rischia di perdere la Maimeri, 48 posti di lavoro a rischio
- Chiusura parziale della Cerca a Mediglia: interventi di manutenzione programmati
Ne parlano su altre fonti
- Mediglia, è sciopero: "Per la Maimeri rischio chiusura" - "C’è il rischio che la produzione venga trasferita. Si parla dell’Inghilterra. La sede di Mediglia chiuderebbe dunque i battenti". Preoccupati per il loro futuro, protestano i lavoratori della Maimeri ... (msn.com)
- Mediglia rischia di perdere la Maimeri, 48 posti di lavoro a rischio - LA PROTESTA Tra un settimana il picchetto dei lavoratori dell’azienda che è stata il riferimento di qualità per generazioni di pittori e di appassionati di Belle arti ... (ilcittadino.it)

author: CNN Newsource
title: Retiran del mercado pasta instantánea con pollo vendida en Kroger y Walmart tras reporte de brote de listeria - KVIA
text:
Retiran del mercado pasta instantánea con pollo vendida en Kroger y Walmart tras reporte de brote de listeria
Por Asuka Koda, CNN
Las comidas instantáneas de fettuccine Alfredo con pollo vendidas en Walmart y Kroger fueron retiradas del mercado tras un brote de listeria que causó 17 casos de esta enfermedad, incluyendo tres muertes y una pérdida fetal.
El Servicio de Inspección y Seguridad Alimentaria del Departamento de Agricultura (FSIS, por sus siglas en inglés) de EE.UU. está investigando el brote, que ha afectado a personas en 13 estados. La cepa del brote se identificó en personas enfermas desde agosto de 2024 hasta mayo de 2025, y el FSIS indicó que la misma cepa fue aislada durante pruebas de rutina en un establecimiento de FreshRealm en marzo. El FSIS aún investiga si un ingrediente específico del fettuccine Alfredo con pollo es la fuente del brote.
FreshRealm informó que los productos se vendieron a nivel nacional en Walmart bajo la marca Marketside y en Kroger bajo la marca Home Chef.
Los productos afectados son:
- Bandejas de 32.8 onzas (unos 930 gramos) con “Marketside Grilled Chicken Alfredo with Fettuccine Tender Pasta with Creamy Alfredo Sauce, White Meat Chicken and Shaved Parmesan Cheese” con fecha de caducidad del 27 de junio o anterior.
- Bandejas de 12.3 onzas (unos 344 gramos) con “Marketside Grilled Chicken Alfredo with Fettuccine Tender Pasta with Creamy Alfredo Sauce, White Meat Chicken, Broccoli and Shaved Parmesan Cheese” con fecha de caducidad del 26 de junio o anterior.
- Bandejas de 12.5 onzas (unos 354 gramos) con “Home Chef Heat & Eat Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo with pasta, grilled white meat chicken, and Parmesan cheese” con fecha de caducidad del 19 de junio o anterior.
Provinieron de FreshRealm, con sede en Texas, y tienen los números de establecimiento Est. P-50784, Est. P-47770 o Est. P-47718 dentro de la marca de inspección del Departamento de Agricultura de Estados Unidos (USDA, por sus siglas en inglés). El fabricante afirma que el retiro voluntario no aplica a otros productos de FreshRealm.
El FSIS dice que le preocupa que los productos retirados puedan estar en los refrigeradores o congeladores de los consumidores. No deben ser consumidos y los clientes deben tirar los productos o devolverlos al lugar de compra.
El consumo de alimentos contaminados con Listeria monocytogenes puede causar listeriosis, una infección grave que puede provocar fiebre, dolores musculares, dolor de cabeza, rigidez en el cuello, confusión, pérdida de equilibrio y convulsiones. Estos síntomas a veces pueden estar precedidos por diarrea u otros síntomas gastrointestinales. En mujeres embarazadas, la infección puede causar abortos espontáneos, muerte fetal, parto prematuro o infecciones potencialmente mortales en el recién nacido. También puede causar infecciones graves y, a veces, mortales en adultos mayores y personas con sistemas inmunológicos debilitados. La listeriosis se trata con antibióticos.
El FSIS insta a las personas en categorías de mayor riesgo que experimenten síntomas similares a los de la gripe dentro de los dos meses posteriores a haber consumido alimentos contaminados con listeria a buscar atención médica y notificar a su proveedor de salud.
El FSIS también enfatiza que las comidas preparadas solo deben consumirse cuando se cocinan a una temperatura de 165 grados Fahrenheit (unos 74 grados Celsius). La única manera de confirmar que las comidas preparadas han alcanzado una temperatura lo suficientemente alta como para eliminar bacterias dañinas, incluida la listeria, es usar un termómetro de alimentos que mida la temperatura interna.
